title: Pinto Configuration (Wallet Event Card Support)
custom_preconds:
[BP-10045](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10045 )
[BPA-6710](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6710 )

Prerequisite - Remote Config Setup for: Pinto Configuration (Wallet Event Card Support)
1. Go to Firebase -> Remote Config (links below)
2. Edit "enable_pinto" as needed to force display.
3. Save changes.
4. Publish changes.

BE CAUTIOUS WHEN UPDATING PROD CONFIGURATION AS CHANGES WOULD BE WITNESSED TO LIVE USER

Remote Configs 
[Ballpark QA App](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-mobile-npd/config)
[Ballpark](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/config)
(can have condition set up to differentiate desired behavior for different envs/platform/target_audience)

NOTE: Making changes to the configuration may take a few minutes to propagate and/or require a few app restarts


GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into Ballpark (installed 12.1.0 or later)
AND User has verified their account
AND User has tickets to an upcoming game*

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN the enable_pinto configuration has been updated and published to 'false'
WHEN the user is on the Wallet Tab w/ ticketed events
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the event information will contain The event date / time in the format (Ex. Sat, Jun 22 . 1:07 PM ET)
AND beneath the date time will be the Matchup Info displayed as Away Team @ Home Team
AND below the Matchup will be the Event's Venue
AND user is shown Wallet event card(s) WITHOUT attached button options

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user accesses the event card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the native listview for the event is shown*

*For TDC clubs, if TM event then the TMSDK is presented

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN the enable_pinto configuration has been updated and published to 'true'
WHEN the user is on the Wallet Tab w/ ticketed events
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the event information will contain The event date / time in the format (Ex. Sat, Jun 22 . 1:07 PM ET)
AND beneath the date time will be the Matchup Info displayed as Away Team @ Home Team
AND below the Matchup will be the Event's Venue
AND user is shown Wallet event card(s) WITH two attached button options
*Button one to read “Sell Tickets”
*Button two to read “Open Tickets”

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user accesses the event card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the native listview for the event is shown*

*For TDC clubs, if TM event then the TMSDK is presented

*further validation of the CTAs (OPEN and SELL) are covered within [Wallet Event Card support (Pinto)](https://testrail.testeng.mlbinfra.net/index.php?/suites/view/589798&group_by=cases:section_id&group_order=asc&group_id=1634091 )

title: Sell Tickets CTA - TDC support
custom_preconds:
As a Ballpark user, I want an easy & quick way to sell my baseball tickets through SeatGeek so that I can sell tickets to games I cannot attend

GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into Ballpark (installed 12.1.0 or later)
AND User has verified their account 
AND User has tickets to an upcoming game*


*TDC Club

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user logs into BP app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown Home tab, where fans will only have the option to “Open Tickets”

[NOTE: Next Ticketed Event card shows soonest event, if multiple ticketed events present on the acct]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user navigates to Wallet View (via Tickets Tab)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown event card(s) with two button options 
*Button one to read “Sell Tickets” 
*Button two to read “Open Tickets”

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Sell Tickets' for a particular Wallet event card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN BP app will deeplink user to TDC MyTickets webpage*

*URL for TDC Clubs → [F2F Links](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ksOID6DNL-UFu1rfQjlt3th3h2aS1Nxtk7Q3rkL3fE4/edit#gid=0 )

AND user should be auto-logged in successfully (SSO), therefore not needing to re-enter credentials

*note: if first time accessing the MPV site, then First and Last name prompt may show within webview

title: Open Tickets CTA - TDC support
custom_preconds:
As a Ballpark user, I want an easy & quick way to sell my baseball tickets through SeatGeek so that I can sell tickets to games I cannot attend

GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into Ballpark (installed 12.1.0 or later)
AND User has verified their account 
AND User has tickets to an upcoming game*


*TDC Club

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user logs into BP app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown Home tab, where fans will only have the option to “Open Tickets”

[NOTE: Next Ticketed Event card shows soonest event, if multiple ticketed events present on the acct]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user navigates to Wallet View (via Tickets Tab)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown event card(s) with two button options 
*Button one to read “Sell Tickets” 
*Button two to read “Open Tickets”

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Open Tickets' for a particular Wallet event card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN BP app will direct user to list view of their tickets

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user back navigates from the native ticket listview page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to Wallet View within the Tickets Tab

title: Sell Tickets CTA - TM support
custom_preconds:
As a Ballpark user, I want an easy & quick way to sell my baseball tickets through SeatGeek so that I can sell tickets to games I cannot attend

GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into Ballpark (installed 12.1.0 or later)
AND User has verified their account
AND User has tickets to an upcoming game*

*TM Club

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user logs into BP app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown Home tab, where fans will only have the option to “Open Tickets”

[NOTE: Next Ticketed Event card shows soonest event, if multiple ticketed events present on the acct]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user navigates to Wallet View (via Tickets Tab)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown event card(s) with two button options
*Button one to read “Sell Tickets”
*Button two to read “Open Tickets”

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Sell Tickets' for a particular Wallet event card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN BP app will deeplink user to Ticketmaster Account Manager webpage*

*URL for TM Clubs → [F2F Links](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ksOID6DNL-UFu1rfQjlt3th3h2aS1Nxtk7Q3rkL3fE4/edit#gid=0 ) - i.e. https://am.ticketmaster.com/azdbacks/

title: Open Tickets CTA - TM support
custom_preconds:
As a Ballpark user, I want an easy & quick way to sell my baseball tickets through SeatGeek so that I can sell tickets to games I cannot attend

GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into Ballpark (installed 12.1.0 or later)
AND User has verified their account
AND User has tickets to an upcoming game*

*TM Club

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user logs into BP app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown Home tab, where fans will only have the option to “Open Tickets”

[NOTE: Next Ticketed Event card shows soonest event, if multiple ticketed events present on the acct]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user navigates to Wallet View (via Tickets Tab)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown event card(s) with two button options
*Button one to read “Sell Tickets”
*Button two to read “Open Tickets”

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN BP app will direct user to TMSDK allowing the user to view their tickets within TM

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user back navigates from the TMSDK ticket listview page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to Wallet View within the Tickets Tab

title: NonGame Event - NOT supported for Sell (via Wallet Event Card)
custom_preconds:
[BP-10267](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10267 )


GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into Ballpark 
AND User has verified their account
AND the user has NonGame event tickets already added to the BP account (TM and/or TDC events)

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has NonGame event tickets already added to the BP account (TM and/or TDC events)
WHEN user navigates to Wallet View (via Tickets Tab)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown event card(s) WITHOUT attached button options

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on Wallet NonGame Event card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to Listview of the event (if TDC event)
OR
THEN user is directed into TMSDK webview (if TM event)

title: Pinto - Analytics
custom_preconds:
[BP-10060](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10060 ) / [BPA-6731](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6731)

**TESTING NOTES: THIS CASE REQUIRES TRACKING TO BE VERIFIED - MOST DIRECT WAY TO ACHIEVE THIS IS VIA A PROXY TOOL (.I.E. CharlesProxy)
Setup: Connect to device to Charles to monitor the content passed.

GIVEN the Ballpark application has the Pinto enabled
AND the user downloaded the Ballpark app (12.1.0 or greater)
AND the user has tickets already added to the BP account
AND the Remote Config configuration for [enable_pinto is enabled is true)
AND network traffic is monitored via Proxy tool (such as Charles/Proxyman)
custom_steps: WHEN accessing/viewing Tickets events within BP app
custom_expected:
THEN tracking is monitored in Adobe

On clicks/taps of “sell tickets” fire a trackAction call with the following data:trackAction : MLB Ballpark : Tickets : Wallet : Sell Tickets Click

On clicks/taps of “open tickets” fire a trackAction call with the following data:trackAction : MLB Ballpark : Tickets : Wallet : Open Tickets Click

On clicks/taps of “event card” fire a trackAction call with the following data:trackAction : "MLB Ballpark : Tickets : Wallet : Event Card Click

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks/taps of “sell tickets”
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed into Sell Tickets view 
AND Tracking info is posted to https://mlb.sc.omtrdc.net verified via proxy tool

*MLB Ballpark : Tickets : Wallet : Sell Tickets Click

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks/taps of “open tickets”
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to Open Tickets view
AND Tracking info is posted to https://mlb.sc.omtrdc.net verified via proxy tool

*MLB Ballpark : Tickets : Wallet : Open Tickets Click

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks/taps of “event card”
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is directed into the event card of particular club 
AND Tracking info is posted to https://mlb.sc.omtrdc.net verified via proxy tool

*MLB Ballpark : Tickets : Wallet : Event Card Click"

As a Ballpark user, I want an easy & quick way to sell my baseball tickets through SeatGeek so that I can sell tickets to games I cannot attend

GIVEN user has tickets for TDC event
AND user has navigated to Listview*
WHEN user taps “Forward Tickets”

*user can navigate to Listview many ways:
**HomeTab > NTE Card
**TicketsTab > Wallet Card
**TicketsTab > View All entry

custom_steps_separated.content:

AND user has navigated to Listview*

title: NonGame Event - NOT supported for Sell (via View All, Native Listview)
custom_preconds:
[BP-10267](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10267 )


GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into Ballpark (iOS: 12.1.7 or greater, Android: 12.5.0)
AND User has verified their account
AND the user has NonGame event tickets already added to the BP account (TM and/or TDC events)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user has navigated to View All within TicketsTab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN for NonGame event(s), the user is NOT shown 'Sell Tickets' button BUT is shown 'Open Tickets' button

(if other events are present)
THEN for Game event(s), the user is shown 'Sell Tickets' button AND is shown 'Open Tickets' button

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user taps on NonGame Event entry within View All page
OR
WHEN user taps on NonGame Event entry's 'Open Tickets' button 

*tapping on entry should behave the same as 'Open Tickets'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to Listview of the event (if TDC event)
OR
THEN user is directed into TMSDK webview (if TM event)

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has tickets for TDC NonGame event
AND user has navigated to Listview*


*user can navigate to Listview many ways:
**HomeTab > NTE Card
**TicketsTab > Wallet Card
**TicketsTab > View All entry
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown the Native listview 
AND user is NOT shown 'Sell Tickets' button (*Not supported for NGE) 
AND user is shown 'Forward Tickets' button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps "Open" within the Listview
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is directed into Scanview of the tickets

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps “Forward Tickets” within the Listview
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is directed into Forward Tickets view

title: Pinto+ - Analytics
custom_preconds:
[BP-10170](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10170 ) / [BPA-6844](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6844 ) 
[BP-10173](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10173 ) / [BPA-6845](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6845 ) 

**TESTING NOTES: THIS CASE REQUIRES TRACKING TO BE VERIFIED - MOST DIRECT WAY TO ACHIEVE THIS IS VIA A PROXY TOOL (.I.E. CharlesProxy)
Setup: Connect to device to Charles to monitor the content passed.

GIVEN the Ballpark application has the Pinto enabled
AND the user downloaded the Ballpark app (iOS: 12.1.6 or greater, Android: TBD[12.5.0?])
AND the user has tickets already added to the BP account (TM and TDC events)
AND the Remote Config configuration for [enable_pinto is enabled is true)
AND network traffic is monitored via Proxy tool (such as Charles/Proxyman)
custom_steps: WHEN accessing/viewing Tickets events within BP app
custom_expected:
THEN tracking is monitored in Adobe Analytics: 
On tap of "View All > Sell Tickets" fire a trackAction call with the following data: 
*trackAction : MLB Ballpark : Tickets : Wallet : View All : Sell Tickets Click
On tap of "View All > Open Tickets" fire a trackAction call with the following data:
*trackAction : MLB Ballpark : Tickets : Wallet : View All : Open Tickets Click

On tap of "Listview > Sell Tickets" fire a trackAction call with the following data: 
*trackAction : MLB Ballpark : Tickets : List View : Sell Tickets Click
On tap of "Listview > Forward Tickets" fire a trackAction call with the following data:
*trackAction : MLB Ballpark : Tickets : List View : Forward Tickets Click

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has navigated to View All within TicketsTab
WHEN user taps “Sell Tickets” for TDC club event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed into TDC MyTickets webpage
AND Tracking info is posted to https://mlb.sc.omtrdc.net verified via proxy tool

*MLB Ballpark : Tickets : Wallet : View All : Sell Tickets Click

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has navigated to View All within TicketsTab
WHEN user taps “Open Tickets” for TDC club event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to Listview of the event
AND Tracking info is posted to https://mlb.sc.omtrdc.net verified via proxy tool

*MLB Ballpark : Tickets : Wallet : View All : Open Tickets Click

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has navigated to View All within TicketsTab
WHEN user taps “Sell Tickets” for TM club event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed into Ticketmaster Account Manager webpage
AND Tracking info is posted to https://mlb.sc.omtrdc.net verified via proxy tool

*MLB Ballpark : Tickets : Wallet : View All : Sell Tickets Click

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has navigated to View All within TicketsTab
WHEN user taps “Open Tickets” for TM club event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed into TMSDK webview
AND Tracking info is posted to https://mlb.sc.omtrdc.net verified via proxy tool

*MLB Ballpark : Tickets : Wallet : View All : Open Tickets Click

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has tickets for TDC event
AND user has navigated to Listview*
WHEN user taps “Sell Tickets” for TDC club event


*user can navigate to Listview many ways:
**HomeTab > NTE Card
**TicketsTab > Wallet Card
**TicketsTab > View All entry
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed into TDC MyTickets webpage
AND Tracking info is posted to https://mlb.sc.omtrdc.net verified via proxy tool

*MLB Ballpark : Tickets : List View : Sell Tickets Click
